channel.title: India News, Latest News in India, Live News India, India Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: Get the latest breaking news from India on politics and current affairs.

image.title: India News, Latest News in India, Live News India, India Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: CBI files new evidence in Jagan assets case
item.description: The CBI, which is probing the illegal assets case of Y S Jaganmohan Reddy, filed additional information pertaining to the chargesheet in the Dalmia Cements aspect on Friday.

item.title: Bribery case: Preliminary enquiry registered against Rolls-Royce
item.description: CBI sources also say the sleuths would approach the British serious fraud office for details of their probe into Rolls-Royce.

item.title: Current political scenario in BJP's favor: Jaitely
item.description: Claiming that the current political scenario of the country is evidently working in BJP's favor, senior party leader Arun Jaitely said.

item.title: CBI in the last leg of chopper deal probe
item.description: The Central Bureau of Investigation hopes to conclude its probe of the AgustaWestland deal soon after receiving all relevant documents from Italy in the case.

item.title: Poor turnout at Kiran Reddy's road shows
item.description: Upset over poor turnout at his public meetings, former chief minister and Jai Samaikyandhra Party (JSP) president N Kiran Kumar Reddy hurriedly concluded his first day tour in Krishna district on Friday.

item.title: Can't fast-track case, Delhi high court tells Chautalas
item.description: The Delhi high court refused to grant early hearing to former Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala and others convicted in the teachers recruitment scam.

item.title: Sena to fight in UP, Bihar and Delhi, BJP rattled
item.description: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut’s announcement early on Friday that his party would contest 20 Lok Sabha seats in Uttar Pradesh, including in Varanasi against Narendra Modi and in Lucknow against Rajnath Singh, sent the Bharatiya Janata Party into a tizzy.

item.title: 1984 anti-Sikh riots case: US court seeks copy of Sonia Gandhi's passport
item.description: US-based NGO The Sikhs For Justice had filed the case against Sonia Gandhi for allegedly protecting the perpetrators of the 1984 anti-Sikh riots.

item.title: 70 labs in India cut TB test bill by half
item.description: Improving Access to Affordable & Quality TB Tests (IPAQT) has brought together over 70 diagnostic laboratory chains in India to offer drug-sensitivity tests for TB at half the price.

item.title: Jaya tears into Chidambaram in his home turf
item.description: Pulling up Chidambaram for failing to face the electorate this time for alleged fear of defeat, Jayalalithaa sought the voters to trounce his son Karti Chidambaram who is contesting the election instead of his father.

item.title: EC can’t monitor all e-canvassing
item.description: The EC, in its note to the CEOs, has mentioned that it will keep tabs on online campaigns via social media and the virtual game world.

item.title: Chopper scam: Recovering money paid to Agusta looks difficult
item.description: Chances of India recovering Rs 2360 crore already paid to AgustaWestland for supply of 12 VVIP helicopters, a deal scrapped after delivery of three copters, appeared bleak as a Milan court stalled its move to encash €278 million bank guarantees given by the Italian firm.

item.title: Kudankulam nuclear liability issue sorted out, deal soon
item.description: India and Russia are set to sign the much delayed techno-commercial agreement for Kudankulam 3 and 4 nuclear reactors later this month.

item.title: Parole now only once a year in Maharashtra prisons
item.description: The Bombay high court has upheld the state government's changes in the Prison Rules 2012 restricting release on parole to once a year.

item.title: Maharashtra CM's relief fund gets its act right
item.description: The chief minister's relief fund, which had been mired in controversies for the kind of beneficiaries it used to support, seems to have cleaned up its act.

item.title: AAP to hold fund-raising event in Canada
item.description: A fund-raising programme for Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) will be held at Chandni banquet hall in Toronto on Saturday.

item.title: BJP denies tickets to Advani acolytes Jaswant, Harin Pathak
item.description: A day after veteran BJP leader LK Advani gave up his bid to contest from Bhopal and stick to Gandhinagar, the party axed the candidatures of two leaders — Jaswant Singh and Harin Pathak — seen to be close to him.

item.title: Election failure will mean rejection of my JPC report on 2G scam: Chacko
item.description: Chacko made these observations during an interactive session with the students of the MES College at Marampalli, near Perumbavoor on Friday.

item.title: Rohtang pass opens for pedestrians, but risk remains
item.description: With setting up of rescue posts on either side of the mighty Rohtang pass, the snow-bound mountainous route opened for movement of pedestrians on Friday.

item.title: Family members turn rivals in poll ring
item.description: In Kurukshetra, former Haryana minister Raj Kumar Saini of BJP is pitted against his relative Balbir Saini of INLD.

item.title: Rahul Gandhi insulted Nehru with RSS remarks: BJP
item.description: The remarks of Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi, calling RSS a poisonous organization, has left opposition BJP fuming in Himachal Pradesh.

item.title: Bombay HC tells banks to go easy on crop loan recovery
item.description: Farmers who suffered losses in the recent hailstorms in the state won a reprieve on Friday with the Bombay high court asking banks not to take coercive steps to recover cash crop loans.

item.title: Dollar Rum, Cash Whisky flood poll-bound Punjab
item.description: In Scotch-guzzling Punjab, lesser-known desi liquor brands with foreign names have flooded the market ahead of the April 20 Lok Sabha elections.

item.title: Class VIII passout made presiding officer
item.description: He has only passed class VIII.But Chunilal Das, a storekeeper at Hooghly Dock and Port in Salkia, has a daunting task at hand.He will have to work as a presiding officer in the coming Lok Sabha polls.

item.title: Punjab CM pitches for Jaitley as deputy PM; could ruffle feathers in BJP
item.description: The Punjab CM introduced Arun Jaitley as a future deputy prime minister to people of the border district of Attari during the BJP leader ’s first public rally.
